explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point: <23degC, Initial boiling point: >35degC, UNRTDG Class: 3, PG II

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Rat Oral LD50 value=25000mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol.1(2002)), 28700mg/kg (EHC 122 (1993), DFGOT vol.14 (2000), PATTY (4th, 1994) , ATSDR (1999)), 32400mg/kg (EHC 122 (1993), DFGOT vol.14 (2000), ATSDR (1999)) and 15800mg/kg (EHC 122 (1993), DFGOT vol.14 (2000), ATSDR (1999)). Based on the above data, calculated value was applied for categorization. LD50 value calculation = 19634mg/kg

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: There was the description that death was seen in rabbits at 5 mL/kg (reduced value = 3297mg/kg) at PATTY (4th, 1994). But there was no information on LD50 value, it was not able to be classified since data was insufficient.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Judging it as steam from steam pressure. Calculated based on rat inhalation LC50 (1 hour) = 77000ppm (4 hour equivalent: 38500ppm [135.46mg/L]) (EHC 122 (1993), DFGOT vol.14 (2000)), LC50 (4 hours) = 74000ppm (equivalent: 260.36mg/L) (EHC 122 (1993) and DFGOT vol.14 (2000)) and 48000ppm [equivalent: 168.88mg/L] (MOE Risk Assessment the 1st volume (2002)). But the calculated value was lower than the lowest value among these data, the lowest value (38500ppm [135.46mg/L]) was adopted. And based on this value, it was classified as out of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description that skin irritation was seen in humans evidence of exposure (MOE Risk Assessment The 1st volume (2002), EHC 122 (1993), DFGOT vol.14 (2000), PATTY (4th, 1994), ATSDR (1999)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2A-2B. Based on the description that the ocular irritant property was acknowledged in human exposure examples (MOE Risk Assessment 1st volume (2002)), and on the description that mild irritant property was acknowledged in the rabbits (DFGOT vol.14 (2000)). The level of irritation and resilience are unknown, therefore deliberate categorization was impossible.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although we have descriptions in which it is supposed that sensitizing was not acknowledged in EHC 122 (1993) and DFGOT vol.4 (1992) by Maximization test for 25 humans, we presupposed that we could not classify it since this report singularly is inadequate for considering it as a clear proof of there being no sensitizing property.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is negative result by the dominant lethal test using rodents (EHC 122 (1993), DFGOT vol.4 (1992), ATSDR (1999)), and by the micronucleus test using mammalian erythrocyte(ATSDR (1999)), and by the chromosomal aberration test using mammals marrow cells (DFGOT vol.4 (1992)), it carried out the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since it is not evaluated in the institution indicated in the technical indicator, it cannot be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was considered as category 2 since there is description that the organization injury of the testis accompanied by inhibition of spermatogenesis is observed by inhalation exposure to a rat (EHC 122 (1993), DFGOT vol.4 (1992), IRIS (Access on July 2005) and ATSDR (1999)), and in 1000ppm exposure effect is observed in a testis, muscular atrophy (DFGOT vol.4 (1992)) and weight loss (ATSDR (1999)) were also shown.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although there is descriptions in EHC 122 (1993), ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT vol.4 (1992), and PATTY (4th, 1994) referring to confirmation of giddiness, central nervous system depressant, etc. as acute inhalation toxicity in humans, it was judged that these effects were caused by anesthetic actions. Moreover, it was judged as Category 3 because of descriptions in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994) referring to confirmation of respiratory irritant caused by inhalation exposure to humans, and of a description in PATTY (4th, 1994) referring to confirmation of anesthetic actions.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, peripheral nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, peripheral nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the description that polyneuropathy (disorder of sensory nerve and motor nerves) is observed in human chronic exposure examples (MOE Risk Assessment The 1st volume (2002), EHC 122 (1993), ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT vol.14 (2000), PATTY (4th, 1994), IRIS (2005), Japan Society for Occupational Health advice (1993), and ATSDR (1999)), target organs were judged to be central nervous systems and peripheral nervous systems, and we categorized it as Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour LC50=3.88mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (EHC122, 1991).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 100% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=3.9 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
